segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and I’m just watching it happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes, completely unaware of the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being sneaky, but I don’t really care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on the stool, and it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting for cookies, and I wonder if she’ll get any.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is ruining the floor, but no one seems to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman will eventually turn around and see everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just unfolding, and I’m just observing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy might fall, but I’m not sure what I can do about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t say I’m surprised by any of this—it’s just another day.
segments.speaker: PAR
